4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdTrace.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
11   |  ** 									     **
12   |  **   Description:	The Tcl module-trace routine which provides a con-   **
13   |  **			trolling interface to the modulecmd tracing feature  **
14   |  ** 									     **
15   |  **   Exports:		cmdModuleTrace					     **
16   |  **			GetTraceSel					     **
17   |  **			CheckTracing					     **
18   |  **			CheckTracingList				     **
19   |  ** 									     **
20   |  **   Notes:								     **
21   |  ** 									     **

23   |  ****/

32   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdTrace.c.src.html,v 1.1 2005/11/15 03:43:35 rkowen Exp $";
33   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
34   | 
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | 
39   | #include "modules_def.h"
40   | 
41   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
42   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
43   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
44   | 
45   | typedef	struct	_mod_trace	{
46   |     char	 **re_ptr;		/** Pointer to the reqular expr.     **/
47   | 					/** which identifies the command     **/
48   |     char const	 *cmd;			/** The spelled command for printing **/
49   |     char	 *tracing;		/** The tracing setup	  	     **/
50   |     char	  alloc;		/** Alloc flag		    	     **/
51   | } ModTrace;
52   | 
53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
54   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
55   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
56   | 
57   | #ifdef	WITH_TRACE_LOAD
58   | #   define	MOD_TR_LOAD	WITH_TRACE_LOAD
59   | #else
60   | #   define	MOD_TR_LOAD	_all_off
61   | #endif
62   | 
63   | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_UNLOAD
64   | #   define	MOD_TR_UNLOAD	WITH_TRACE_UNLOAD
65   | #else
66   | #   define	MOD_TR_UNLOAD	_all_off
67   | #endif
68   | 
69   | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_SWITCH
70   | #   define	MOD_TR_SWITCH	WITH_TRACE_SWITCH
71   | #else
72   | #   define	MOD_TR_SWITCH	_all_off
73   | #endif
74   | 
75   | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_DISP
76   | #   define	MOD_TR_DISP	WITH_TRACE_DISP
77   | #else
78   | #   define	MOD_TR_DISP	_all_off
79   | #endif
80   | 
81   | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_LIST
82   | #   define	MOD_TR_LIST	WITH_TRACE_LIST
83   | #else
84   | #   define	MOD_TR_LIST	_all_off
85   | #endif
86   | 
87   | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_AVAIL
88   | #   define	MOD_TR_AVAIL	WITH_TRACE_AVAIL
89   | #else
90   | #   define	MOD_TR_AVAIL	_all_off
91   | #endif
92   | 
93   | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_HELP
94   | #   define	MOD_TR_HELP	WITH_TRACE_HELP
95   | #else
96   | #   define	MOD_TR_HELP	_all_off
97   | #endif
98   | 
99   | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_INIT
100  | #   define	MOD_TR_INIT	WITH_TRACE_INIT
101  | #else
102  | #   define	MOD_TR_INIT	_all_off
103  | #endif
104  | 
105  | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_USE
106  | #   define	MOD_TR_USE	WITH_TRACE_USE
107  | #else
108  | #   define	MOD_TR_USE	_all_off
109  | #endif
110  | 
111  | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_UNUSE
112  | #   define	MOD_TR_UNUSE	WITH_TRACE_UNUSE
113  | #else
114  | #   define	MOD_TR_UNUSE	_all_off
115  | #endif
116  | 
117  | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_UPDATE
118  | #   define	MOD_TR_UPDATE	WITH_TRACE_UPDATE
119  | #else
120  | #   define	MOD_TR_UPDATE	_all_off
121  | #endif
122  | 
123  | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_PURGE
124  | #   define	MOD_TR_PURGE	WITH_TRACE_PURGE
125  | #else
126  | #   define	MOD_TR_PURGE	_all_off
127  | #endif
128  | 
129  | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_CLEAR
130  | #   define	MOD_TR_CLEAR	WITH_TRACE_CLEAR
131  | #else
132  | #   define	MOD_TR_CLEAR	_all_off
133  | #endif
134  | 
135  | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_APROPOS
136  | #   define	MOD_TR_APROPOS	WITH_TRACE_APROPOS
137  | #else
138  | #   define	MOD_TR_APROPOS	_all_off
139  | #endif
140  | 
141  | #ifdef  WITH_TRACE_WHATIS
142  | #   define	MOD_TR_WHATIS	WITH_TRACE_WHATIS
143  | #else
144  | #   define	MOD_TR_WHATIS	_all_off
145  | #endif
146  | 
147  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
148  | /**				      MACROS				     **/
149  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
150  | 
151  | /** not applicable **/
152  | 
153  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
154  | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
155  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
156  | 
157  | static	char	module_name[] = "cmdTrace.c";	/** File name of this module **/
158  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
159  | static	char	_proc_cmdModuleTrace[] = "cmdModuleTrace";
160  | #endif
161  | 
162  | /**
163  |  **  Tracing strings
164  |  **  contain a colon separated list of 'switch on/switch off' selector for
165  |  **  module files. Each selector beginning with a '+' means 'tracing on', '-'
166  |  **  means 'tracing off'.
167  |  **  The +/- switch is followed by the name of the modulefile to which it
168  |  **  belongs. All valif TCL regexps may be specified here.
169  |  **/
170  | 
171  | static	char	_all[] = ".*";
172  | static	char	_all_on[] = "+.*";
173  | static	char	_all_off[] = "-.*";
174  | 
175  | /** 
176  |  **  The tracing selection table
177  |  **/
178  | 
179  | static	ModTrace	TraceSelect[] = {
180  |     { &addRE,		"load",		MOD_TR_LOAD,	0 },	/**  0 **/
181  |     { &rmRE,		"unload",	MOD_TR_UNLOAD,	0 },	/**  1 **/
182  |     { &swRE,		"switch",	MOD_TR_SWITCH,	0 },	/**  2 **/
183  |     { &dispRE,		"display",	MOD_TR_DISP,	0 },	/**  3 **/
184  |     { &listRE,		"list",		MOD_TR_LIST,	0 },	/**  4 **/
185  |     { &availRE,		"avail",	MOD_TR_AVAIL,	0 },	/**  5 **/
186  |     { &helpRE,		"help",		MOD_TR_HELP,	0 },	/**  6 **/
187  |     { &initRE,		"init",		MOD_TR_INIT,	0 },	/**  7 **/
188  |     { &useRE,		"use",		MOD_TR_USE,	0 },	/**  8 **/
189  |     { &unuseRE,		"unuse",	MOD_TR_UNUSE,	0 },	/**  9 **/
190  |     { &updateRE,	"update",	MOD_TR_UPDATE,	0 },	/** 10 **/
191  |     { &purgeRE,		"purge",	MOD_TR_PURGE,	0 },	/** 11 **/
192  |     { &clearRE,		"clear",	MOD_TR_CLEAR,	0 },	/** 12 **/
193  |     { &whatisRE,	"whatis",	MOD_TR_WHATIS,	0 },	/** 13 **/
194  |     { &aproposRE,	"apropos",	MOD_TR_APROPOS,	0 }	/** 14 **/
195  | };
196  | 
197  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
198  | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
199  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
200  | 
201  | static	int	GetTraceTable(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
202  | 				char *cmd,
203  | 				int num);
204  | 
205  | static	int	ChangeTraceSel(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
206  | 				char	*cmd_tab,
207  | 				int	 cmd_tab_size,
208  | 				char	 on_off,
209  | 				char	*module_pat);
210  | 
211  | static	int	CheckTracingPat(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
212  | 					char	*pattern,
213  | 					char	*modulefile);
214  | 
215  | /*++++
216  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
217  |  ** 									     **
218  |  **   Function:		cmdModuleTrace					     **
219  |  ** 									     **
220  |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'trace'			     **
221  |  ** 									     **
222  |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
223  |  ** 									     **
224  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
225  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
226  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
227  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
228  |  ** 									     **
229  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successfull completion	     **
230  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
231  |  ** 									     **
232  |  **   Attached Globals:	TraceSelect	List containing all tracing settings **
233  |  **   			g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
234  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
235  |  **					control everything		     **
236  |  ** 									     **
237  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
238  |  ++++*/
239  | 
240  | int	cmdModuleTrace(	ClientData	 client_data,
241  | 	      		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
242  | 	      		int		 argc,
243  | 	      		char		*argv[])
244  | {
245  |     char 	  on_off = '+';		/** The first argument		     **/
246  |     char	**args;			/** Argument pointer for scanning    **/
247  |     int 	  i, k;			/** Loop counter		     **/
248  |     int		  cmd_tab_size;
249  |     char	 *cmd_table;		/** Command table		     **/
250  |     int		  ret = TCL_OK;
251  | 
252  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
253  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdModuleTrace, NULL);
254  | #endif
255  | 
256  |     /**
257  |      **  Whatis mode?
258  |      **/
259  |     if( g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
260  |         return( TCL_OK);		/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
261  | 	
262  |     /**
263  |      **  Parameter check
264  |      **/
265  |     if( argc < 2) {
266  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "on|off",
267  | 	    "[cmd [cmd ...]]", "[ -module module [module ...]]", NULL))
268  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
269  |     }
270  | 
271  |     /**
272  |      **  On or off?
273  |      **/
274  |     if( !strcmp( argv[ 1], "on"))
275  | 	on_off = '+';
276  |     else if( !strcmp( argv[ 1], "off"))
277  | 	on_off = '-';
278  |     else {
279  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "on|off",
280  | 	    "[cmd [cmd ...]]", "[ -module module [module ...]]", NULL))
281  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
282  |     }
283  |  
284  |     /**
285  |      **  Display mode?
286  |      **/
287  |     if( g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
288  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s\t ", argv[ 0]);
289  | 	for( i=1; i<argc; i++)
290  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s ", argv[ i]);
291  | 	fprintf( stderr, "\n");
292  |         return( TCL_OK);		/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
293  |     }
294  | 
295  |     /**
296  |      **  We need a table of module command involved in this trace selection.
297  |      **  Allocate one and initialize it.
298  |      **/
299  |     cmd_tab_size = sizeof( TraceSelect) / sizeof( TraceSelect[ 0]);
300  |     if((char *) NULL == (cmd_table = (char *) malloc( cmd_tab_size)))
301  | 	return((OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) ? TCL_OK : TCL_ERROR);
302  | 
303  |     /**
304  |      **  Scan all commands specified as options. The last option to be scanned
305  |      **  is either the real last one, or the '-module' one
306  |      **/
307  |     args = argv + 2; i = argc - 2;
308  |     memset( cmd_table, !i, cmd_tab_size);
309  | 
310  |     while( i--) {
311  | 	char *tmp = *args++;
312  | 
313  | 	/**
314  | 	 **  Check for '-module'
315  | 	 **/
316  | 	if( !strncmp( tmp, "-module", strlen( tmp)))
317  | 	    break;
318  | 
319  | 	/**
320  | 	 **  This should be a module command.
321  | 	 **  Check it against the TraceSelect table
322  | 	 **/
323  | 	if( -1 != (k = GetTraceTable(interp, tmp, cmd_tab_size))) {
324  | 	    cmd_table[ k] = 1;
325  | 	} else {
326  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_COMMAND, LOC, tmp, NULL)) {
327  | 		null_free((void *) &cmd_table);
328  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);
329  | 	    }
330  | 	}
331  | 
332  |     } /** while( i--) **/
333  | 
334  |     /**
335  |      **  Now scan all Modulefiles concerned in the current command
336  |      **  If we ran to the end of the argument list (i==0), ALL files are
337  |      **  concerned in this ...
338  |      **/
339  |     if( 0 >= i) {	
340  | 	ret = ChangeTraceSel(interp, cmd_table, cmd_tab_size, on_off, _all);
341  |     } else {
342  | 	while( i-- && TCL_OK == ret) 
343  | 	    ret = ChangeTraceSel(interp, cmd_table, cmd_tab_size,
344  | 		on_off, *args++);
345  |     }
346  | 
347  |     /**
348  |      **  Cleanup finally and return
349  |      **/
350  |     null_free((void *) &cmd_table);
351  | 
352  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
353  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdModuleTrace, NULL);
354  | #endif
355  | 
356  |     return( ret);
357  | 
358  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleTrace' **/
359  | 
360  | /*++++
361  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
362  |  ** 									     **
363  |  **   Function:		GetTraceTable					     **
364  |  ** 									     **
365  |  **   Description:	Returns the TraceSelect index for the passed module  **
366  |  **			subcommand					     **
367  |  ** 									     **
368  |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
369  |  ** 									     **
370  |  **   Parameters:	char	*cmd		Subcommand to be checked     **
371  |  **			int	 num		Number of commands to be chk **
372  |  ** 									     **
373  |  **   Result:		int	>= 0		Successfull completion	     **
374  |  **				-1		Any error		     **
375  |  ** 									     **
376  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
377  |  ++++*/
378  | 
379  | static	int	GetTraceTable(Tcl_Interp *interp, char *cmd, int num)
380  | {
381  |     int k;
382  | 
383  |     for( k=0; k < num; k++) {
384  | 	if( Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, cmd, *(TraceSelect[k].re_ptr))) 
385  | 	    return( k);			/** ----------- Got it ------------> **/
386  |     } /** for( k) **/
387  | 
388  |     /**
389  |      **  Not found ..
390  |      **/
391  |     return( -1);
392  | 
393  | } /** End of 'GetTraceTable' **/
394  | 
395  | /*++++
396  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
397  |  ** 									     **
398  |  **   Function:		GetTraceSel					     **
399  |  ** 									     **
400  |  **   Description:	Retrieve the trace selection pattern for the passed  **
401  |  **			module command					     **
402  |  ** 									     **
403  |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
404  |  ** 									     **
405  |  **   Parameters:	char	*cmd		Subcommand to be checked     **
406  |  ** 									     **
407  |  **   Result:		char *	NULL		Module subcommand not found  **
408  |  **				Otherwise	Assigned trace pattern	     **
409  |  ** 									     **
410  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
411  |  ++++*/
412  | 
413  | char	*GetTraceSel(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
414  | 			char	*cmd)
415  | {
416  |     int k;
417  | 
418  |     if( -1 == (k = GetTraceTable(interp, cmd,
419  | 	(sizeof( TraceSelect) / sizeof( TraceSelect[ 0]) ))))
420  | 	return((char *) NULL);
421  | 
422  |     return( TraceSelect[ k].tracing);
423  | 
424  | } /** End of 'GetTraceSel' **/
425  | 
426  | /*++++
427  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
428  |  ** 									     **
429  |  **   Function:		ChangeTraceSel					     **
430  |  ** 									     **
431  |  **   Description:	Change the trace selection for all commands speci-   **
432  |  **			fied in the passed 'cmd_table'. The passed module-   **
433  |  **			name has to be changed according 'on_off'	     **
434  |  ** 									     **
435  |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
436  |  ** 									     **
437  |  **   Parameters:	char	*cmd_table	Boolean array indicating all **
438  |  **						commands in the TraceSelect  **
439  |  **						table to be changed	     **
440  |  **			int	 cmd_tab_size	Size of this array	     **
441  |  **			char	 on_off		'+' switch tracing on	     **
442  |  **						'-' switch tracing off       **
443  |  **			char	*module_pat	Pattern for the affected     **
444  |  **						module files		     **
445  |  ** 									     **
446  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successfull completion	     **
447  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
448  |  ** 									     **
449  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
450  |  ++++*/
451  | 
452  | static	int	ChangeTraceSel(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
453  | 				char	*cmd_table,
454  | 				int	 cmd_tab_size,
455  | 				char	 on_off,
456  | 				char	*module_pat)
457  | {
458  |     char	*pattern, *s, *t, *tmp;
459  |     int		 len = strlen( module_pat);
460  |     int 	 i;
461  |     int		 ret = TCL_OK;
462  | 
463  |     /**
464  |      **  Need a buffer for to build the complete pattern
465  |      **/
466  |     if((char *) NULL == (pattern = (char *) malloc( len + 2))) {
467  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
468  | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
469  |     }
470  | 
471  |     /**
472  |      **  Check if this is the ALL pattern. If it is, replace all affected
473  |      **  entries with '_all_on' or '_all_off'
474  |      **/
475  |     if( !strcmp( module_pat, _all)) {
476  | 
477  | 	for( i=0; i < cmd_tab_size; i++) {
478  | 	    if( cmd_table[ i]) {
479  | 
480  | 		if( TraceSelect[ i].alloc)
481  | 		    null_free((void *) &(TraceSelect[ i].tracing));
482  | 		TraceSelect[ i].alloc = 0;
483  | 
484  | 		TraceSelect[ i].tracing = ('+' == on_off) ?
485  | 		    _all_on : _all_off;
486  | 	    }
487  | 	}
488  | 
489  |     } else { /** if( ALL pattern) **/
490  | 
491  | 	/**
492  | 	 **  Check the pattern for colons ...
493  | 	 **/
494  | 	if( strchr( module_pat, ':')) 
495  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_COLON, LOC, module_pat, NULL))
496  | 		ret = TCL_ERROR;
497  | 
498  | 	if( TCL_OK == ret) {
499  | 
500  | 	    /**
501  | 	     **  Build the complete pattern
502  | 	     **/
503  | 	    *pattern = on_off;
504  | 	    strcpy( pattern + 1, module_pat);
505  | 	    len += 1;
506  | 
507  | 	    /**
508  | 	     **  Loop for all entries to be changed
509  | 	     **/
510  | 	    for( i=0; i < cmd_tab_size; i++) {
511  | 		if( cmd_table[ i]) {
512  | 
513  | 		    /**
514  | 		     **  allocate a buffer for the new pattern
515  | 		     **/
516  | 		    if((char *) NULL == (tmp = (char *) malloc( len + 2 +
517  | 			strlen( TraceSelect[ i].tracing)))) {
518  | 			if( OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) {
519  | 			    continue;
520  | 			} else {
521  | 			    ret = TCL_ERROR;
522  | 			    break;
523  | 			}
524  | 		    }
525  | 
526  | 		    /**
527  | 		     **  Copy the new pattern to the buffer at first
528  | 		     **/
529  | 		    strcpy( tmp, pattern);
530  | 		    t = tmp + len;
531  | 
532  | 		    /**
533  | 		     **  Tokenize the old pattern and remove duplicates
534  | 		     **/
535  | 		    for( s = strtok( TraceSelect[ i].tracing, ":");
536  | 			 s;
537  | 			 s = strtok( NULL, ":") ) {
538  | 
539  | 			if( strcmp( (s+1), module_pat)) {
540  | 			    *t++ = ':';
541  | 			    while( *t++ = *s++);
542  | 			    t--;
543  | 			}
544  | 
545  | 		    } /** for **/
546  | 
547  | 		    /**
548  | 		     **  Finally check if we have to dealloc and set up the
549  | 		     **  new pattern
550  | 		     **/
551  | 
552  | 		    if( TraceSelect[ i].alloc)
553  | 			null_free((void *) &(TraceSelect[ i].tracing));
554  | 
555  | 		    TraceSelect[ i].tracing = tmp;
556  | 		    TraceSelect[ i].alloc = 1;
557  | 
558  | 		} /** if **/
559  | 	    } /** for **/
560  | 
561  | 	} /** if( ret) **/
562  |     } /** if( ALL pattern) **/
563  | 	
564  |     /**
565  |      **  Free what has been allocated an return 
566  |      **/
567  |     null_free((void *) &pattern);
568  |     return( ret);
569  | 
570  | } /** End of 'ChangeTraceSel' **/
571  | 
572  | /*++++
573  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
574  |  ** 									     **
575  |  **   Function:		CheckTracing					     **
576  |  ** 									     **
577  |  **   Description:	Check wheter thracing is turned on for the passed    **
578  |  **			command and modulefile				     **
579  |  ** 									     **
580  |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
581  |  ** 									     **
582  |  **   Parameters:	char	*cmd		Subcommand to be checked     **
583  |  **			char	*modulefile	Modulefile to be checked     **
584  |  ** 									     **
585  |  **   Result:		int	0		No tracing		     **
586  |  **				1		Tracing enabled		     **
587  |  ** 									     **
588  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
589  |  ++++*/
590  | 
591  | int	CheckTracing(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
592  | 			char	*cmd,
593  | 			char	*modulefile)
594  | {
595  |     int 	 k;
596  | 
597  |     /**
598  |      **  Get the TraceSelect table index
599  |      **/
600  | 
601  |     if( -1 == (k = GetTraceTable(interp, cmd,
602  | 	(sizeof( TraceSelect) / sizeof( TraceSelect[0]) )))) {
603  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_COMMAND, LOC, cmd, NULL);
604  | 	return( 0);
605  |     }
606  | 
607  |     /**
608  |      **  Now check this guy ...
609  |      **/
610  | 
611  |     return( CheckTracingPat(interp, TraceSelect[ k].tracing, modulefile));
612  | 
613  | } /** End of 'CheckTracing' **/
614  | 
615  | /*++++
616  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
617  |  ** 									     **
618  |  **   Function:		CheckTracingPat					     **
619  |  ** 									     **
620  |  **   Description:	Check the passed pattern if it enables tracing for   **
621  |  **			the passed module file				     **
622  |  ** 									     **
623  |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
624  |  ** 									     **
625  |  **   Parameters:	char	*pattern	Pattern to be checked	     **
626  |  **			char	*modulefile	Modulefile to be checked     **
627  |  ** 									     **
628  |  **   Result:		int	0		No tracing		     **
629  |  **				1		Tracing enabled		     **
630  |  ** 									     **
631  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
632  |  ++++*/
633  | 
634  | static	int	CheckTracingPat(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
635  | 					char	*pattern,
636  | 					char	*modulefile)
637  | {
638  |     char	*s;
639  |     int		 ret;
640  | 
641  |     /**
642  |      **  Tokenize the pattern and check if it matches ...
643  |      **/
644  | 
645  |     for( s = strtok( pattern, ":");
646  | 	 s;
647  | 	 s = strtok( NULL, ":") ) {
648  | 
649  | 	ret = ('+' == *s++);
650  | 	if( Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, modulefile, s))
651  | 	    return( ret);
652  | 
653  |     } /** for **/
654  | 
655  |     /**
656  |      **  No pattern matched the module file name ...
657  |      **/
658  | 
659  |     return( 0);
660  | 
661  | } /** End of 'CheckTracingPat' **/
662  | 
663  | /*++++
664  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
665  |  ** 									     **
666  |  **   Function:		CheckTracingList				     **
667  |  ** 									     **
668  |  **   Description:	Check wheter tracing is turned on for the passed     **
669  |  **			command and at least one of the passed modulefiles   **
670  |  ** 									     **
671  |  **   First Edition:	95/12/26					     **
672  |  ** 									     **
673  |  **   Parameters:	char	*cmd		Subcommand to be checked     **
674  |  **			int	 count		Number of passed modulefiles **
675  |  **			char	**modules	Modulefiles to be checked    **
676  |  ** 									     **
677  |  **   Result:		int	0		No tracing		     **
678  |  **				1		Tracing enabled		     **
679  |  ** 									     **
680  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
681  |  ++++*/
682  | 
683  | int	CheckTracingList(	Tcl_Interp *interp,
684  | 				char	 *cmd,
685  | 				int	  count,
686  | 				char	**modules)
687  | {
688  |     int 	 k;
689  | 
690  |     /**
691  |      **  Get the TraceSelect table index
692  |      **/
693  | 
694  |     if( -1 == (k = GetTraceTable(interp, cmd,
695  | 	(sizeof( TraceSelect) / sizeof( TraceSelect[0]) )))) {
696  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_COMMAND, LOC, cmd, NULL);
697  | 	return( 0);
698  |     }
699  | 
700  |     /**
701  |      **  Now check whether one of them requires tracing
702  |      **/
703  | 
704  |     while( count--)
705  |         if( CheckTracingPat(interp, TraceSelect[ k].tracing, *modules++))
706  | 	    return( 1);
707  | 
708  |     return( 0);
709  | 
710  | } /** End of 'CheckTracingList' **/
711  |
